title: Do not allow new level 30's doing placements in promo games.
body:
If you dodge in placements it's an automatic loss. This just allowed me being held hostage by the matchmaking system. I noticed one of our players was unranked with a huge match history of negative scores. Fair enough could be a few off games (He ended up going 0-10).

Oh well, next game will be better! It happens. Then the sum of all fears happens... that exact player got matched with me a second time. Unable to dodge I suck it up. He ends up going 0-12 this time - Apologizing the entire game for being a new level 30 and not knowing a lot of champs ability's yet.

I'm in Silver 1 promos. I want to know why both games I got the exact same unranked new player who had to vs someone in Gold each time. Both games were solely lost from him doing his placements in a skill bracket way above his.

In normals, if you get stuck in this situation you have the option to dodge. Sadly; Silver is constantly getting people in their placement games thrown randomly into your matches.

like I said.. it's possible to climb with < 50% winrate. Which means that grinding enables you to climb if certain situations are met.

In theory, that's false. If you are constantly playing versus teams with a better mmr than yours you are expected to lose more than you win. And thus you could be climbing even though you do not have a good winrate.

In reality it evens out so yes you can't really climb with less than 50% winrate. For quite a simple reason : 
if your mmr is increasing because you stacked slowly but surely underserved win due to the fact there are more leavers in the ennemy team, you are matched with and against people who are better than you. So you become a burden for your team and you end up losing a few more games.

in theory.

in reality, it happens.

I have a friend whos on 48% winrate and climbed from gold 2 to plat 5 lol. While still being under 50%.
Sure, he probably picked it up and won more games than losses in this period, but that's exactly my point. He's grinding it out and eventually the losses and wins will even out. Someone who has less time than him wouldn't have been able to grind that 48% winrate to plat.

<50% winrate still allows you to climb a little until your MMR matches the Rank you're in. So if you have <50% winrate but you still win more points than you lose, you can still climb slowly but surely.

Bronze, Diamond, Unranked, these are just decorative. Internally, the system works based purely on MMR. For some reason this noob in his game had Silver 1 MMR, that's the real problem.
Because for placements it never considers your performance. Normals MMR is never accurate. I've played with diamond players in normals, and I'm G5.

I've heard that the first few games in placements are weighed more heavily. So a new player to ranked, upon winning his first game would get a gigantic boost in MMR that subsequent losses won't cover unless it's several losses in a row.

The issue isn't so much that, as the baseliness MMR for a player never having played in ranked is 1200 MMR. That is essentially Silver already (the 1100 range is Bronze). So before you play a single game, you are in Silver, where you probably aren't skill wise (yes yes Silver is bad, but most players that don't play ranked are pretty poor skill wise even compared to low silver players).

I'm not sure I would say "unranked v unranked" cause that would be a nightmare of a queue time for them, but simply "unranked can't be matched with those in Promo matches" and that's fixed. It is literally that simple.

It's not hard to code, but it'd be hard as fuck to get these people matches. You realize it takes like 3-5 mins on average to find a game out of a pool of the entire playerbase. That pool goes from 10m+ people down to thousands, which would rise the ques to 10-20 minutes for someone to find a match, and thats if no one dodges champ select. It'd be similar to the pbe where it can take literally multiple hours to get into a match.
Did you also notice the diamond smurf they added to your team to make the math work?

That's even worse. It's not matching people on an even level. That would be like

1+1+1+1+1 vs 1+1+1+1+1

Instead OP's game was

0+6+1+1+2 vs 2+2+2+2+2
The 0 should be a negative. In some cases an afk is better than a new level 30
